name: qsv-fmt
description: Reformat a CSV with different delimiters, record terminators or quoting rules. (Supports ASCII delimited data.)

options.description: Use ASCII field and record separators. Use Substitute (U+00A1) as the quote character.
Use '\r\n' line endings in the output.
The field delimiter for reading CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)
The escape character to use. When not specified, quotes are escaped by doubling them.
Do not write a newline at the end of the output. This makes it easier to paste the output into Excel.
The field delimiter for writing CSV data. Must be a single character. If set to "T", uses tab as the delimiter.
Write output to <file> instead of stdout.
Never put quotes around any value.
